title: Rolls-Royce Weekly News Summary
body:
**Rolls-Royce Announces £200 Million Share Buyback Program**

On December 16, 2025, Rolls-Royce Holdings PLC announced an interim share buyback program of up to £200 million, following the completion of a £1 billion buyback in November. The new program is set to commence on January 2, 2026, and conclude by February 24, 2026, ahead of the company's full-year 2025 results scheduled for February 26, 2026. UBS AG London Branch will manage the buyback, with shares purchased intended for cancellation to reduce share capital. ([proactiveinvestors.com](https://www.proactiveinvestors.com/companies/news/1084488/rolls-royce-tops-up-returns-with-interim-share-buyback-1084488.html?utm_source=openai))

**Analyst Updates on Rolls-Royce Holdings**

Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft raised its price target for Rolls-Royce Holdings plc from GBX 1,000 to GBX 1,220, indicating a potential upside of 12.13% from the stock's previous close. The stock currently holds a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy," with four analysts issuing buy ratings and one hold rating. ([ts2.tech](https://ts2.tech/en/rolls-royce-holdings-plc-stock-rr-l-rr-latest-december-2025-news-share-price-analyst-forecasts-and-key-catalysts/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Berenberg upgraded Rolls-Royce from a 'Sell' to a 'Hold' rating, citing expectations of improved fleet dynamics through 2035 and ongoing operational improvements within the group. The upgrade reflects a potential shift in market sentiment towards the aerospace and defense giant. ([asktraders.com](https://www.asktraders.com/analysis/rolls-royce-stock-shifts-to-neutral-as-berenberg-cites-favorable-fleet-dynamics/?utm_source=openai))

key_dates.title: Commencement of £200 Million Share Buyback Program
key_dates.importance_for_price: The initiation of the share buyback program is likely to positively influence the stock price by reducing the number of outstanding shares, thereby increasing earnings per share.

key_dates.title: Conclusion of Share Buyback Program
key_dates.importance_for_price: The conclusion of the buyback program may lead to a reassessment of the stock's value, potentially affecting its price depending on the program's impact on share capital.

key_dates.title: Full-Year 2025 Results Announcement
key_dates.importance_for_price: The release of the full-year financial results will provide insights into the company's performance, influencing investor sentiment and potentially impacting the stock price.

key_points.text: Rolls-Royce announced a £200 million share buyback program to commence on January 2, 2026.
Deutsche Bank raised its price target for Rolls-Royce to GBX 1,220, indicating a positive outlook.
Berenberg upgraded Rolls-Royce's rating from 'Sell' to 'Hold,' reflecting improved fleet dynamics and operational enhancements.
